attributes.title: The Maternal and Infant Care Clinic at UWMC

body.value:
Comprehensive maternity care for low- to high-risk pregnancies

The Maternal and Infant Care Clinic at UW Medical Center​ provides comprehensive pregnancy-related services and ongoing obstetric care for women in low- to high-risk pregnancies.

We also offer childbirth, parenting and breastfeeding classes​, as well as mental healthcare services including psychiatric consultations, medication management and recommendations for continued psychiatric care.

For a closer look at our facility please view our ​labor and delivery video tour. ​Elegant and spacious birthing suites have Jacuzzis and entertainment systems. The Maternal and Infant Care Clinic at UWMC offers a wide range of specialty care, including diabetic care in pregnancy; premature birth prevention; care for multiple gestations (twins, triplets); hypertension in pregnancy; infectious disease in pregnancy (including care for HIV-positive mothers and their babies); prenatal genetic counseling; prenatal diagnosis and management of fetal anomalies; and antenatal fetal testing, triage and lactation services, including assessment and treatment of Ankyloglossia (tongue-tie).

In addition, The Maternal and Infant Care Clinic ​at UWMC offers consultation and continuity of care in all areas of obstetrics, including pregnancy complicated by maternal disease (chronic or acute) and maternal disability.

attributes.title: Northwest Primary Care Outpatient Medical Center

body.value:
We've got North Seattle covered for comprehensive primary care healthcare

Open six days a week and offering evening and same-day appointments, the Northwest Primary Care Outpatient Medical Center provides a wide range of services to meet your healthcare needs.

Our board-certified physicians feel strongly that continuity of care – a shared goal that fosters ongoing, caring relationships between patients and healthcare providers – is vital to keeping you healthy in the long term.

From annual wellness and preventive healthcare services to management of chronic conditions, treatment of acute conditions, mental health services and routine gynecologic exams, we strive to meet your needs quickly, and with thoughtful care.

We accept most major insurance plans. Make your appointment today.

body.value:
Eye Center at UW Medical Center offers a broad range of eye care services

The Eye Center at UW Medical Center – part of UW Medicine’s Eye Institute -- offers general ophthalmologic and subspecialty services. Our staff provides comprehensive treatment for people with glaucoma, cataracts, diseases of the retina, cornea, orbit and nerves and age-related eye diseases. We also perform refractive procedures such as LASIK and oculofacial plastic surgery procedures.

Our UWMC patients also have access to the highly-specialized services offered at the affiliated Eye Institute, based in Harborview's Ninth & Jefferson Building.
body.processed:

We also perform refractive procedures such as LASIK and oculofacial plastic surgery procedures.

Our UWMC patients also have access to the highly-specialized services offered at the affiliated Eye Institute, based in Harborview's Ninth & Jefferson Building.

body.value:
Complete eye services, centrally located in Seattle

The Ophthalmology (Eye) Clinic at Harborview—part of UW Medicine’s Eye Institute—offers a complete range of vision care including dilated eye exams, tests for visual field defects and management of ocular diseases, including glaucoma and diabetic retinopathy.

Located in Harborview’s 4W Clinic, the Ophthalmology Clinic specializes in emergency, trauma and burn services, as well as other complex medical and surgical eye care services.

body.value:
Coordinated, comprehensive care for ear, nose and throat conditions on the Eastside

UW Medicine’s Eastside Specialty Center in Bellevue is one of a kind—a multi-specialty outpatient clinic featuring some of the most highly-qualified, experienced and caring physicians UW Medicine has to offer. Our patients receive comprehensive specialty care from providers who are leaders in their fields of practice, and all at a convenient Eastside location.

Our otolaryngology physicians provide comprehensive services related to diseases of the ear, nose and throat, including ear infections, hearing loss, dizziness, chronic sinusitis, chronic tonsillitis, hoarseness, voice disorders, swallowing problems, thyroid nodules, snoring, sleep apnea, facial cosmetic and reconstructive surgery and surgical treatment of cancers of those regions.

body.value:
Comprehensive ear, nose and throat care in northwest Seattle

At Northwest Otolaryngology our physicians and a team of clinical audiologists and audiometric technicians treat all disorders of the ear, nose and throat (ENT).

Our physicians offer broad-based otolaryngology care for adults and children. They provide a wide range of ENT diagnostic and surgical expertise, including the treatment of dizziness and vertigo, neurotology and audiology, including hearing aids, auditory implants and hearing loss rehabilitation.

Our audiological staff also offers forensic diagnostic hearing testing, hearing aids, custom hearing protection and plugs and balance testing.

attributes.title: Audiology Services - Otolaryngology/Head and Neck Surgery Center at UW Medical Center

body.value:
Comprehensive hearing assessments and rehabilitation services

Audiology Services - Otolaryngology/Head and Neck Surgery Center at UW Medical Center is dedicated to the identification, assessment and rehabilitation of patients with hearing disorders.

Our audiologists see patients referred for hearing evaluation and hearing rehabilitation services. They also provide hearing assessments that assist our otologist in the diagnosis of hearing disorders.

Assessments provided include speech audiometry and middle ear assessment, cochlear function monitoring, ototoxicity monitoring and physiological testing of auditory brain and facial nerve function.

Rehabilitation services include hearing aid evaluation and dispensing, cochlear implants and devices for patients with middle ear disorders who cannot wear traditional hearing aids.

body.value:
Comprehensive rehabilitation medicine and therapies at Harborview for adults with injuries

The Rehabilitation Medicine Clinic at Harborview Medical Center offers comprehensive care for adults recovering from spinal cord injury, traumatic brain injury, stroke or amputations. We offer follow-up care for UW Medicine patients discharged from our acute care and rehabilitation unit.

Patients are the center of our multidisciplinary team. Care team members include doctors who specialize in rehabilitation medicine (physiatrists), rehabilitation nurses, physical, occupational and speech therapists, patient care coordinators, therapeutic recreation specialists, vocational rehabilitation counselors, rehabilitation psychologists and social workers.

Together we work to achieve your goals and optimize your recovery.

Together we work to achieve your goals and optimize your recovery.

attributes.title: Center for Medical Rehabilitation at Northwest

body.value:
Integrated rehabilitation services in North Seattle

Northwest Hospital’s Center for Medical Rehabilitation provides a full range of rehabilitation services, from occupational, physical and speech language therapy services, for conditions ranging from stroke and brain injury to neurological disorders and physical conditions.

Our rehabilitation center offers treatment for stroke, amputations, brain injury, spinal cord injury, major multiple trauma, congenital deformities, neurological disorders, complicated orthopedics, polyarticular rheumatoid arthritis, severe or advanced osteoarthritis, systemic vasculitides with joint inflammation and other debilitating conditions.

We also treat patients who are suffering a decline in physical fitness following an illness or a surgical procedure, or who are dealing with an inability to manage daily activities due to functional impairments.

body.value:
Comprehensive breast care, imaging services and support at Northwest Hospital

At the Seattle Breast Center at Northwest Hospital, we offer a variety of services and resources, from cancer screening and prevention to support groups and education.

Our comprehensive care begins with state-of-the-art digital mammograms to aid in the earliest possible detection of breast cancer.

If patients need follow-up studies, we provide a comprehensive range of testing and treatment services in one convenient location.

We believe that you have a better chance of fighting breast cancer if you understand the risk factors and the treatment options, so our multidisciplinary team works together with you to provide the most comprehensive and individualized care available.

attributes.title: General Internal Medicine Center at UWMC-Roosevelt

body.value:
One-stop, personalized care in the University District

Located in the University District, the General Internal Medicine Center at UWMC-Roosevelt provides comprehensive primary care for adult patients, including preventive medicine services, assessment and treatment of acute medical problems and monitoring and treatment of chronic diseases. We are a dynamic teaching clinic, focused on providing patient-centered care grounded in the best available medical evidence.

Our mental healthcare professionals provide a range of services including psychiatric consultations, medication management and recommendations for continued psychiatric care. You can also access many specialized care services in this location, making this a convenient place to get the coordinated care UW Medicine is known for.

Same-day appointments are always available, and the care team accepts most major insurance plans. Make your appointment today.

Same-day appointments are always available, and the care team accepts most major insurance plans. Make your appointment today.

body.value:
Complete colorectal care provided by a world-class, multidisciplinary team

The Colorectal Surgery Clinic at UW Medical Center provides surgical consultation for the diagnosis and treatment of disorders and cancers of the colon, rectum, anus and pelvic floor.

Our team includes surgeons who are fellowship trained and board certified in colon and rectal surgery, advanced practice providers, and enterostomal therapists.

Our expertise includes the management of complex colorectal diseases and conditions including colon, rectal and anal cancers; sphincter-preserving procedures for anorectal malignancies; treatment of inflammatory bowel disease such as Crohn’s and ulcerative colitis; diverticulitis; and surgery and treatment of pelvic floor disorders such as organ prolapse and incontinence.

We treat patients using innovative and advanced minimally-invasive approaches including laparoscopic, robotic and transanal platforms. Operative care focuses on minimizing pain and enhancing post-operative recovery to improve functional outcomes and quality of life. We evaluate each case comprehensively and strive to provide outstanding care and accountability to every patient we treat.

attributes.title: Digestive Health Center at the Eastside Specialty Center

body.value:
Comprehensive digestive health and liver care in Bellevue

Developed for the convenience of our patients on the Eastside, the Digestive Health Center at the Eastside Specialty Center provides procedural and consultative services for digestive and liver disorders. Our team of UW Medicine physicians and advanced practice providers are experts in the care of patients with all gastrointestinal and liver disorders, such as inflammatory bowel disease (Crohn’s disease and ulcerative colitis), gastrointestinal motility and functional bowel disorders (irritable bowel syndrome or IBS), esophageal and swallowing disorders, and all liver diseases, including viral hepatitis.

We provide comprehensive evaluations for common symptoms, such as abdominal pain, nausea and vomiting, and diarrhea or constipation. In addition, we offer onsite endoscopic procedures, including upper endoscopy and colonoscopy.
body.processed:
Comprehensive digestive health and liver care in Bellevue

We provide comprehensive evaluations for common symptoms, such as abdominal pain, nausea and vomiting, and diarrhea or constipation. In addition, we offer onsite endoscopic procedures, including upper endoscopy and colonoscopy.

attributes.title: Hepatitis and Liver Clinic at Harborview

body.value:
Comprehensive hepatitis and liver care at Harborview

The Hepatitis and Liver Clinic at Harborview Medical Center evaluates and treats patients with chronic hepatitis B and C infections and other chronic liver diseases. These include non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, alcoholic liver disease, autoimmune hepatitis, hemochromatosis, primary biliary cholangitis and primary sclerosing cholangitis.

We offer physical examinations, lab testing, imaging studies (including CT and MRI scanning), transient elastography (FibroScan), liver biopsy and disease-specific treatments, among other services.

We also provide comprehensive care for patients with cirrhosis (extensive liver scarring) that may arise from chronic liver disease. This includes monitoring and treatment for symptoms of cirrhosis as well as preventive care such as screening for varices (large veins in the esophagus that can bleed) or liver cancer. Some patients with chronic liver disease may require liver transplantation. Our physician team can help patients make that determination along with appropriate referrals.
body.processed:

We also provide comprehensive care for patients with cirrhosis (extensive liver scarring) that may arise from chronic liver disease. Some patients with chronic liver disease may require liver transplantation. Our physician team can help patients make that determination along with appropriate referrals.

body.value:
Personalized nutrition counseling for the whole family at Harborview

Nutrition Services at Harborview Medical Center provides nutrition-related evaluations and education to patients of all ages at many outpatient clinics.

Our registered dietitians work with your healthcare providers to help improve your health through quality food and lifestyle choices. They provide an individual consultation, assess your nutrition and offer personalized recommendations.

Dietitians also offer healthy meal planning guidance and teach nutrition classes at Harborview's Patient and Family Resource Center.

Whether you are interested in controlling weight, blood pressure, cholesterol or addressing other medical issues, you’re encouraged to focus on areas that are important to you.

body.value:
Comprehensive digestive health care at UW Medical Center

Located in the Surgery Pavilion at UW Medical Center, the Digestive Health Center offers a full range of consultations and procedures for the care of digestive disorders and problems of the gastrointestinal system. Conditions treated include abdominal pain, gastroesophageal reflux disease, swallowing disorders, celiac disease, nutrition disorders, inflammatory bowel diseases such as Crohn’s disease and ulcerative colitis, disorders of the pancreas and bile ducts, and functional gastrointestinal and motility disorders such as irritable bowel syndrome.

The Digestive Health Center also offers screening services for prevention and early diagnosis of gastrointestinal cancers. This includes colorectal cancer screening procedures such as colonoscopy and surveillance of other precancerous conditions such as Barrett’s esophagus or intestinal metaplasia of the stomach.

This center provides a full range of gastrointestinal endoscopy procedures using a flexible, camera-mounted tube to look into the gastrointestinal tract in order to diagnose and treat problems. Most commonly, these include upper endoscopies to examine the esophagus, stomach or upper small intestine and colonoscopies to examine the large intestine. The center also offers advanced procedures such as endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP) to diagnose and treat disorders of the pancreas and bile ducts and endoscopic ultrasound (EUS) to image structures deep within the esophagus, stomach and pancreas.
body.processed:

body.value:
Digestive system screening at Harborview

The Endoscopy Suite at Harborview Medical Center provides the full range of endoscopic procedures, including diagnostic and screening colonoscopy and upper endoscopy as well as advanced therapeutic interventions including  endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP), endoscopic ultrasound, wireless capsule endoscopy and balloon-assisted enteroscopy. Our endoscopy center also has therapeutic options and techniques not yet available elsewhere, such as endoscopic submucosal dissection for treatment of gastrointestinal cancers.

Our endoscopy center also has therapeutic options and techniques not yet available elsewhere, such as endoscopic submucosal dissection for treatment of gastrointestinal cancers.

body.value:
Comprehensive digestive health care at Harborview Medical Center

The Gastroenterology Clinic at Harborview offers expert consultations and comprehensive care for a wide-spectrum of digestive disorders and problems of the gastrointestinal system. Our clinic features a dedicated inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) team to treat Crohn’s disease and ulcerative colitis and an infusion center. Providers also have expertise in gastrointestinal motility and functional bowel disorders such as irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), esophageal and swallowing disorders, diverticular disease and diseases of the pancreas and bile ducts.

Our team aims to provide exemplary care with compassion. The quality of care provided at the Gastroenterology Clinic is evidenced by our adenoma detection rates (the most important quality measure for screening colonoscopy), which are among the highest in the country. Harborview is also one of the primary academic teaching institutions affiliated with University of Washington School of Medicine.

body.value:
Expert, innovative care for acute and chronic liver disorders

Located at University of Washington Medical Center, our Hepatology Clinic provides innovative, comprehensive care for patients with acute and chronic liver disorders.

Our highly trained multidisciplinary liver care team includes dedicated hepatologists, liver transplant surgeons, hepatobiliary surgeons, medical and surgical oncologists, diagnostic and interventional radiologists, and nurse coordinators — each with specialized knowledge about liver function and disease.

We provide outstanding care for simple and complex liver conditions. Whether you're seeking a diagnosis, managing a chronic condition or need care for a toxic liver injury, we provide the full range of treatment options based on the latest research protocols.

body.value:
Better health through nutrition for adults and children at UW Medical Center

At the Nutrition Clinic at UW Medical Center, our providers are highly-trained registered dietitians who work with your medical team. We specialize in providing medical nutrition therapy to adults and children.

Our dietitians provide education on lifestyle and dietary changes to help you improve your health. They develop an individualized nutrition plan that addresses your lifestyle and dietary needs, and will support you as you make changes to reach your goals.

Because good nutrition affects the whole family, we encourage you to bring a family member or significant other to your appointment.

Palliative and Supportive Care at Northwest

body.value:
Support and relief for patients with serious, long-lasting or life-threatening illnesses

In addition to providing inpatient palliative care at Northwest Hospital and Medical Center, the UW Medicine Palliative and Supportive Care team can help patients manage difficult symptoms and support them in coping with their illness in-clinic or at home.

Our team works closely with the patient’s other healthcare providers to address physical symptoms; practical aspects of daily living; and emotional, social and spiritual needs that may arise during serious illness in order to support the best possible quality of life for patients and their families.

Home visits are available on a limited basis in North King County for those who have difficulty leaving their homes. One of our providers is available 24 hours a day.
body.processed:
Support and relief for patients with serious, long-lasting or life-threatening illnesses

In addition to providing inpatient palliative care at Northwest Hospital and Medical Center, the UW Medicine Palliative and Supportive Care team can help patients manage difficult symptoms and support them in coping with their illness in-clinic or at home.

Our team works closely with the patient’s other healthcare providers to address physical symptoms; practical aspects of daily living; and emotional, social and spiritual needs that may arise during serious illness in order to support the best possible quality of life for patients and their families.

Home visits are available on a limited basis in North King County for those who have difficulty leaving their homes. One of our providers is available 24 hours a day.

attributes.title: Inpatient Palliative Care Services at UW Medical Center

body.value:
Compassionate palliative and supportive care services at UWMC

The Palliative Care team at UW Medical Center partners with patients and their families to develop a treatment plan to relieve the symptoms, pain and stress of serious illness, regardless of the patient’s age, the stage of their disease or their need for additional care. We also work with those who have ended curative treatments.

Our team will also connect patients and their caregivers to resources and support groups and help manage the feelings that come with serious illness.

We also help with pain management, making end-of-life decisions and navigating the grief process.

body.value:
Complete digestive health care in North Seattle​​​​

At Northwest Medical Specialties, physicians trained in conditions of the liver and digestive system (hepatologists and gastroenterologists) offer comprehensive medical and surgical treatment for patients with disorders of the liver and digestive tract. Our physicians seamlessly combine advanced technologies with compassionate care to detect, diagnose and treat complex conditions of the liver, pancreas, gall bladder, esophagus, stomach, small intestine and colon.

Our hepatologists, led by nationally recognized clinician, researcher and lecturer Dr. Anne M. Larson, diagnose and treat liver conditions ranging from liver cancer to hepatitis to end-stage liver disease. We strive to help patients understand their liver disease and review all possible treatment options, including liver oncology, hepatology, surgical services and liver transplantation.

Our gastroenterology team provides comprehensive preventive, diagnostic and therapeutic services for disorders and diseases of the GI tract. Our gastroenterologists have extensive experience in diagnostic and interventional endoscopy. We diagnose and treat a broad range of conditions including functional and structural disorders, inflammatory bowel diseases, gastro-esophageal reflux and cancer of the gastrointestinal tract.
body.processed:
Complete digestive health care in North Seattle​​​​

Our hepatologists, led by nationally recognized clinician, researcher and lecturer Dr. Anne M. Larson, diagnose and treat liver conditions ranging from liver cancer to hepatitis to end-stage liver disease. We strive to help patients understand their liver disease and review all possible treatment options, including liver oncology, hepatology, surgical services and liver transplantation.

Our gastroenterology team provides comprehensive preventive, diagnostic and therapeutic services for disorders and diseases of the GI tract. Our gastroenterologists have extensive experience in diagnostic and interventional endoscopy. We diagnose and treat a broad range of conditions including functional and structural disorders, inflammatory bowel diseases, gastro-esophageal reflux and cancer of the gastrointestinal tract.

body.value:
Personalized care for all women, conveniently located in Ballard

Conveniently located in Seattle’s booming Ballard neighborhood, Meridian Women's Health at Ballard provides a full range of obstetrics and gynecology care, from wellness exams to pregnancy care to the latest in minimally invasive surgery. Our services also include family planning, nutritional counseling, management of menopausal issues and screenings for early detection and treatment of many gynecologic problems.

We work with you to develop an individually tailored care plan that includes your physical, emotional, social and spiritual health.

At Meridian Women's Health at Ballard, we believe women deserve the best that is available in modern medicine combined with clear communication and education.

body.value:
Comprehensive healthcare on the UW campus, conveniently located

​​​Located on the UW campus, Hall Health Center is an outpatient clinic that provides healthcare to UW students and their dependents, alumni, faculty, staff and community members.

The clinic provides an extensive array of services, with an emphasis on the unique healthcare needs of the UW community.

Our compassionate, board-certified physicians and nurse practitioners hold clinical faculty appointments at the UW School of Medicine, making them fellow Dawgs.

The care team accepts most major insurance plans. Make your appointment today.

attributes.title: Tuberculosis Control Clinic/Public Health-Seattle & King County at Harborview

body.value:
Tuberculosis care and prevention at Harborview for Seattle and King County residents

The mission of the Tuberculosis Control Clinic, located at Harborview Medical Center, is to interrupt the transmission of tuberculosis in Seattle and King County. The clinic is a public health service that provides evaluation and treatment for individuals diagnosed with or suspected of having active tuberculosis or those who were recently exposed to infectious tuberculosis.

Clinic services are available by appointment only.

body.value:
Trusted patient guidance for pulmonary and respiratory conditions at Harborview

The Chest Clinic at Harborview cares for patients with respiratory diseases such as asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), lung cancer, asbestosis, emphysema, sarcoidosis, pulmonary fibrosis, cavitary lung disease, bronchiectasis, occupational lung disease and pleural effusions.

We also provide smoking cessation assistance, pulmonary function testing, fiber optic bronchoscopy, lung cancer screening and thoracentesis services.

attributes.title: Hand, Elbow & Shoulder Center at UWMC-Roosevelt

body.value:
Comprehensive orthopedic and musculoskeletal care

Located in the University District, the care team at the Hand, Elbow & Shoulder Center at UWMC-Roosevelt provides comprehensive orthopedic and musculoskeletal care, with the goal of helping you return to normal life activities.

Our board-certified specialists have experience treating complex injuries and chronic conditions. We perform surgery on the shoulder, elbow, wrist and hand, and minimally invasive shoulder and elbow arthroscopy.

attributes.title: Clinical Lab and Blood Draw at Harborview

body.value:
Conveniently located blood draw and urinalysis in Seattle

UW Medicine offers five conveniently-located blood draw labs in Seattle where UW Medicine patients and the broader community who have received physician’s orders can have their blood drawn and urine collected for various health tests.

Certified and state-licensed phlebotomists and clinical laboratory technicians collect blood, urine and other fluid samples.

The main lab processes the samples and records the results in the patient’s electronic medical record for review by the ordering provider. The provider then communicates the results to the patient.

attributes.title: Seattle Cancer Care Alliance at South Lake Union
Allergy Clinic at Eastside Specialty Center

body.value:
Comprehensive allergy care on the Eastside

The Allergy Clinic at Eastside Specialty Center in Bellevue provides consultation and evaluation for allergic rhinitis, asthma, stinging insect allergic rhinitis, asthma, stinging insect allergy, urticarial/angioedema, food and drug allergies, eczema, contact dermatitis, anaphylaxis, immunodeficiency disorders, allergen immunotherapy (allergy shots) and medication desensitization.

Our board-certified physicians specialize in primary care, internal medicine, and allergy and immunology treatment and care. For your convenience, we also have an allergy clinic at UW Medical Center in Seattle.

Our board-certified physicians specialize in primary care, internal medicine, and allergy and immunology treatment and care. For your convenience, we also have an allergy clinic at UW Medical Center in Seattle.

Our board-certified physicians are trained in primary care, internal medicine, and allergy and immunology treatment and care. For your convenience, we also have an allergy clinic at Eastside Specialty Center in Bellevue.

body.value:
Allergy testing and management at Harborview

This clinic specializes in consultation and evaluation, diagnosis and treatment of allergy and inflammation-related conditions, such as severe asthma, anaphylaxis, medication desensitization, immunotherapy (allergy shots), immune system deficiencies and immunodeficiency diseases.

Conveniently located at Harborview Medial Center near downtown Seattle, our patients also have access to diverse specialty care across disciplines.

Conveniently located at Harborview Medial Center near downtown Seattle, our patients also have access to diverse specialty care across disciplines.

body.value:
Complete care for infants, children and teens

The Pediatric Clinic at Harborview offers a wide range of services including well-child and sick care, developmental screenings, breastfeeding support, confidential teen services and mental health services, including psychiatric consultations, medication management and recommendations for continued psychiatric care.

Same-day appointments are available for sick kids, and a 24-hour nurse phone line is available when you need immediate care assistance.

Specialty services, including dental screenings, are also available through the Pediatric Clinic, the Foster Care Clinic and the Adolescent Medicine Clinic. In addition we are pleased to provide books, bicycle helmets and other safety supplies.

We offer interpreter services for non-English speaking families as well as assistance dealing with health insurance paperwork and problems. The Pediatric Clinic at Harborview can also make referrals to Harborview’s Community House Calls program to coordinate care for immigrant and refugee families.

attributes.title: Clinical Lab and Blood Draw at Northwest Hospital

body.value:
Accurate, cost-effective and timely lab testing at Northwest Hospital

Clinical Lab and Blood Draw at Northwest Hospital & Medical Center offers comprehensive laboratory services that include chemistry, coagulation, hematology, immunology, microbiology, serology and urinalysis.

Our professional staff perform testing and evaluate and report results to help provide answers to physicians and patients, whether you’re a hospital inpatient or your physician has referred you for a specific test.

We’re inspected and accredited by the College of American Pathologists and federally licensed by the Department of Health and Human Services.

Our specially trained pathologists, phlebotomists and medical technologists have access to the latest instrumentation for quick and accurate outpatient testing which enables us to perform millions of tests each year.

We also offer testing services to physician offices, nursing homes and community screening programs, providing more than $500,000 in free lab services around the greater Seattle area each year.

attributes.title: Clinical Lab and Blood Draw at Outpatient Medical Center

body.value:
Accurate, cost-effective and timely lab testing in North Seattle

The Clinical and Blood Draw Laboratory at Northwest Hospital’s Outpatient Medical Center offers comprehensive laboratory services that focus on monitoring and detecting disease. Our professional staff perform testing and evaluate and report results to help provide answers to physicians and patients, whether you’re a hospital inpatient or your physician has referred you for a specific test.

Inspected and accredited by the College of American Pathologists, we’re federally licensed by the Department of Health and Human Services. Our services include chemistry, coagulation, hematology, immunology, microbiology, serology and urinalysis.

Our team includes specially-trained pathologists, phlebotomists and medical technologists. They’re equipped with the latest instrumentation for quick and accurate outpatient testing which enables us to perform millions of tests each year.

We also offer testing services to physician offices, nursing homes and community screening programs, providing more than $500,000 in free lab services around the greater Seattle area each year.
